newsitem.title: HONG KONG: SQUATTERS FLEE FIRE AFTER RAT GNAWS WIRING.
newsitem.headline: SQUATTERS FLEE FIRE AFTER RAT GNAWS WIRING.

text.p: A fire probably started by a rat Gnawing through electrical wiring forced dozens of squatters to flee their shacks in Hong Kong on Thursday.

Local television stations showed residents fleeing the smoke and flames and firefighters hosing down the tin-sheet and wood makeshift homes in the Diamond Hill area of the Kowloon peninsula. A nearby underground station had to be briefly closed.

Initial investigations pointed to electrical wiring as the probable cause of the blaze, the television reports said, adding that a power cut caused by a rat knawing through wires had been reported just before the fire started.
One firefighter was taken to hospital but later released.
